zone.line: to earth as a silly sparrow when pounced
on by a hawk; my eyes swam and my
head was bewildered by the sudden appari
tion of grief. Day after day passed marked
only by my complaints and my tears; often
I lifted my soul in vain prayer for a
softer descent from joy to woe, or if that
were denied me that I might be allowed
to die, and fade for ever under the
cruel blast that swept over me
̶ ̶̶̶ ̶̶ for what should I do here,
Like a decaying flower, still withering
Under his bitter words, whose kindly heat
Should give my poor heart life? X
Sometimes I said to myself, this is
an enchantment, and I must strive
against it. My father is blinded by some
malignant vision which I must remove.
And then, like David, I would try music
to win the evil spirit from him; and
once while singing I lifted my eyes towards
him and saw his fixed once on me and
filled with tears; all his muscles seemed
relaxed to softness. I sprung towards him
X Fletcher’s comedy of the Captain.
